content: I was able to find no online examples of the @[lint_driver] setting in lakefile.lean. How to set it up so that files are automatically styled correctly when I press Ctrl+S in VS Code? Does Lean / Elan / Lake come with a default linting tool? I noticed that I can write stuff without leaving spaces in between, for example, and they don't get corrected.
It sounds like you're asking for a formatting tool, not just a linting tool; and right now no such tool exists
OK, if it doesn't exist then it's fine I guess :D
spamegg has marked this topic as resolved.

Mathlib has a very crude linter that simply flags possible style issues: if you use set_option linter.ppRoundtrip true, then the linter will be active and will flag style issues. However, it has many false positive and false negatives, so it is more of a suggestion, than an actual formatter.
